intro: Farsetia ovalis, commonly known as the oval farsetia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Farsetia ovalis thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
